title: Has the US been in a justified war since WW2? - Quora

response.answer_text: You mean when we rolled out to prevent North Korea from overrunning South Korea in a blatant invasion bid that almost succeeded? Say what you will about how it was executed and the underlying motives, but the first Gulf War in 1991 also constituted an intervention to preserve the sovereignty of another nation, so… Tardily and lamely intervening to stop attempted genocide in the former Yugoslav states counts. And Afghanistan in 2001 leaps to mind. Now, in all cases, execution fell short of what could be desired, and muddy policy gummed up (and/or outright caused) every single one of them, but… And these are merely the ones where my jaded and cynical eye sees justification- in some cases decades after the fact. Make no mistake, we’re a warlike nation, and we spend entirely too much time dropping bombs on people continents away, but… let us not oversell the malice underpinning those actions.

You can justify, or unjustified any war. Really, can any war be truly justified. I think stopping the Communists in Korea was noble, we fought to attempt to resolve a war in Vietnam, stopped Saddam Hussein because he was raping a neighbor and then finished the job while getting rid of people who murdered civilians by the thousand. that all sounds justifiable or not. I would prefer there be no war but nations, especially big ones, can get entangled.
The US hasn't been in a war since the institution of the Federal reserve that wasn't preceded by false flags to draw us in. With any crime, follow the money.
Congress hasn’t voted to go to war since WW2. Ever since then it’s been the presidents orders of where our soldiers fight and for what reasons. Justifying this is a matter of perspective.
Are you claiming the U S had a justified war in WW 1 and WW 2? Do you know the machinations the state dept, the democrats, and the president had to twist into place to get their wars?
Korean War, War against Iraq to free Kuwait, Invasion of Iraq. Invasion of Afghanistan. War against ISIS in Syria.
No. The United States has not gone to War since WW2. Military Actions, Police Actions, Use of Force Yes. War, no.
